title: NASA to Cover Northrop Grumman Cygnus Departure from Space Station
summary: Northrop Grumman’s uncrewed Cygnus spacecraft is scheduled to depart the International Space Station on Tuesday, June 28, more than four months after delivering 8,300 pounds of supplies, scientific investigations, commercial products, hardware, and other cargo to the orbiting laboratory for NASA.

title: Lawmakers seek to accelerate asteroid finder and want more Mars helicopters
summary: In general, the House budget writers appear to largely support NASA's activities.

title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket’s NASA Psyche launch delayed to 2023
summary: NASA says that its mission to the asteroid 16 Psyche will no longer be able to launch in 2022 after engineers were...

title: Axiom and Collins only bidders for NASA spacesuit contracts
summary: The two companies NASA selected earlier this month to develop spacesuits for the International Space Station and Artemis lunar missions were the only companies to bid on the project, according to agency procurement documents.

title: U.K. government announces new space sustainability measures
summary: The British government announced a series of measures June 23, from regulations to funding active debris removal projects, intended to make the country a leader in space sustainability.

title: InSight teams push for more science in lander’s final months, Curiosity continues trek around Gale Crater
summary: In May 2022, members of NASA’s InSight Mars lander team announced that power levels on the lander were diminishing and that they expected the lander to become inoperative by December 2022. However, InSight’s teams want to push the lander to do as much as possible in its final months and have chosen to operate the lander’s seismometer for longer than previously planned.

title: New head of Space Force acquisitions looks to get back to basics
summary: Frank Calvelli, assistant secretary of the Air Force for space acquisition and integration, told SpaceNews one of his priorities is to impose discipline in procurement programs

title: Telespazio to play key role in satellite servicing market
summary: Telespazio intends to play a key role in the future in-orbit servicing market, providing customers seeking satellite relocation, refueling, repair or removal with the necessary space and ground-based capabilities.

title: NASA targeting late summer launch for first Artemis moon rocket
summary: With a series of practice countdowns complete, NASA managers said Friday the powerful Space Launch System rocket could be ready for its first test flight in late August or early September to send an unpiloted Orion crew capsule around the moon.

title: Software testing problem delays Psyche launch
summary: NASA’s Psyche asteroid mission will not launch this year as previously planned after the agency concluded there was not enough time to complete testing of the spacecraft’s software before its launch window closes.
